paragraphs.zh-tw: Today I am going to teach you how to play my favorite game: massively multiplayer thumb-wrestling. It's the only game in the world that I know of that allows you, the player, the opportunity to experience 10 positive emotions in 60 seconds or less.
paragraphs.en: 今天我要教你們 怎麼玩我最愛的遊戲： 超級多人拇指摔角 這是我所知的唯一一個 可以讓你，也就是玩家 得以在六十秒內 體驗十種正面心情的遊戲

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is true, so if you play this game with me today for just one single minute, you will get to feel joy, relief, love, surprise, pride, curiosity, excitement, awe and wonder, contentment, and creativity, all in the span of one minute. So this sounds pretty good, right?Now you're willing to play.
paragraphs.en: 這是真的，因此如果你今天和我玩這個遊戲 只需要一分鐘 你將會感受到喜悅、解脫、愛、驚喜 驕傲、好奇、興奮、敬畏與驚奇 滿足，以及創造力 這都將在一分鐘內發生 聽起來很不錯吧？你現在會願意玩這個遊戲了

paragraphs.zh-tw: In order to teach you this game, I'm going to need some volunteers to come up onstage really quickly, and we're going to do a little hands-on demo. While they're coming up, I should let you know, this game was invented 10 years ago by an artists' collective in Austria named Monochrom.
paragraphs.en: 為了教你們這個遊戲 我需要一些自願者 很快地到台上來 然後我們將會親身示範 在等他們上來的同時我該讓你們知道 這個遊戲是在十年前，由一位奧地利 藝術收藏家Monochrom發明的

paragraphs.zh-tw: So thank you, Monochrom. Okay, so most people are familiar with traditional, two-person thumb-wrestling.
paragraphs.en: 謝謝你，Monochrom 好的，大部份的人都對 傳統的兩人拇指摔角很熟悉

paragraphs.zh-tw: Sunni, let's just remind them. One, two, three, four, I declare a thumb war, and we wrestle, and of course Sunni beats mebecause she's the best.
paragraphs.en: Sunni，我們幫他們複習一下吧 一，二，三，四當我說拇指比賽，然後我們就開始 當然Sunni會打敗我因為她是最厲害的

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now the first thing aboutmassively multiplayer thumb-wrestling, we're the gamer generation. There are a billion gamers on the planet now, so we need more of a challenge.
paragraphs.en: 玩多人拇指摔角，（要知道）的第一件事情 就是我們身處玩家的世代 現在全世界有十數億個玩家 所以我們面臨大挑戰

paragraphs.zh-tw: So the first thing we need is more thumbs. So Eric, come on over.
paragraphs.en: 首先，我們需要更多的拇指 所以，來吧，Eric

paragraphs.zh-tw: So we could get three thumbs together, and Peter could join us. We could even have four thumbs together, and the way you win is you're the first personto pin someone else's thumb.
paragraphs.en: 我們把三個拇指湊在一起 然後Peter可以加入我們 我們甚至可以把四個拇指湊在一起 如果你是第一個 把別人的拇指按住的人，你就贏了

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is really important. You can't, like, wait while they fight it out andthen swoop in at the last minute. That is not how you win.
paragraphs.en: 這很重要 你不能在一旁觀戰，然後在最後才突然壓下來 這樣子贏了不算

paragraphs.zh-tw: Ah, who did that? Eric you did that. So Eric would have won. He wasthe first person to pin my thumb.
paragraphs.en: 噢，是誰？是Eric 這樣Eric就贏了他是第一個把我的拇指壓住的

paragraphs.zh-tw: Okay, so that's the first rule, and we can see that three or four is kind of the typical number of thumbs in a node, but if you feel ambitious,you don't have to hold back. We can really go for it.
paragraphs.en: 好，這就是第一條規則 三個或四個拇指 是在一個節點中常見的拇指數量 但是如果你很有野心的話別憋在心裡 我們真的可以爭取更多

paragraphs.zh-tw: So you can see up here. Now the only other rule you need to remember is, gamer generation, we like a challenge.
paragraphs.en: 你可以看到 你要記住的另外一條規則就是 身為玩家世代的一員，我們喜歡挑戰

paragraphs.zh-tw: I happen to notice you all have some thumbs you're not using. So I think we should kind of get some more involved.
paragraphs.en: 讓我提醒你們，你們都有一些 你現在沒在用的拇指 所以我覺得我們應該試點其他的

paragraphs.zh-tw: And if we had just four people, we would do it just like this, and we would try and wrestle both thumbs at the same time. Perfect.
paragraphs.en: 如果我們只有四個人 我們可以這樣做 同時用兩隻拇指摔角 同時用兩個拇指摔角 太好了

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now, if we had more people in the room, instead of just wrestling in a closed node, we might reach out and tryand grab some other people. And in fact, that's what we're going to do right now.
paragraphs.en: 好，如果這房間裡有更多人 我們可以往外延伸讓更多人參與我們 而不是只在一個封閉的節點裡玩摔角 事實上這就是我們現在要做的

paragraphs.zh-tw: We're going to try and get all, something like, I don't know, 1,500 thumbs in this room connected in a single node. And we have to connect both levels, so if you're up there, you're going to be reaching down and reaching up.
paragraphs.en: 我們要試著把這房間裡所有的 我不確定，大概1500個拇指 在一個節點裡面連接起來 我們得連結兩層樓 所以如果你在樓上的話 你就要同時連接樓上和樓下

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now —  — before we get started -- This is great. You're excited to play. — before we get started, can I havethe slides back up here really quick, because if you get good at this game, I want you to know there are some advanced levels. So this is the kind of simple level, right? But there are advanced configurations.
paragraphs.en: 現在---- 在我們開始之前 很好。你們已經等不及了-- 在我們開始之前我在上面再放幾張投影片 因為如果你對這個遊戲很在行的話 我想讓你知道還有其它進階版 這看其來是基本款對吧？ 但是還有其它種高級組合

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is called the Death Star Configuration. Any Star Wars fans? And this one's called the Möbius Strip.
paragraphs.en: 這叫做「死星組合」 這裡有星際大戰迷嗎？ 這個叫做莫比烏斯帶

paragraphs.zh-tw: Any science geeks, you get that one. This is the hardest level. This is the extreme.
paragraphs.en: 你是科學狂的話就會知道 這是最高級的非常困難

paragraphs.zh-tw: So we'll stick with the normal one for now, and I'm going to give you 30 seconds, every thumb into the node, connect the upper and the lower levels, you guys go on down there. Thirty seconds. Into the network. Make the node.
paragraphs.en: 所以我們先玩個正常的 我會給你們30秒的時間 把每一個拇指放到節點裡面 連結樓上和樓下 你們可以到台下 30秒建立連結，形成節點

paragraphs.zh-tw: Stand up! It's easier if you stand up. Everybody, up up up up up! Stand up, my friends.
paragraphs.en: 站起來！站起來會容易一點 所有人站起來，站起來站起來！ 站起來吧，我的朋友

paragraphs.zh-tw: All right. Don't start wrestling yet.
paragraphs.en: 好的 還不要開始摔角

paragraphs.zh-tw: If you have a free thumb, wave it around, make sure it gets connected. Okay. We need to do a last-minute thumb check.
paragraphs.en: 如果你還有多出的拇指揮揮手 確認都有連結了 好做最後的確認

paragraphs.zh-tw: If you have a free thumb,wave it around to make sure. Grab that thumb! Reach behind you. There you go.
paragraphs.en: 如果你還有多出的拇指揮揮手 抓住那個拇指！ 在你後面就是這樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: Any other thumbs? Okay, on the count of three, you're going to go. Try to keep track. Grab, grab, grab it.
paragraphs.en: 還有其它拇指嗎？ 好數到三就開始 隨時注意。抓好抓好抓好

paragraphs.zh-tw: Okay? One, two, three, go! Did you win? You got it? You got it? Excellent! Well done. Thank you. Thank you very much. All right.
paragraphs.en: 好了嗎？一，二，三，開始！ 你贏了嗎？你贏了？你贏了？太好了！ 做得好。謝謝你們非常感謝你們 好的

paragraphs.zh-tw: While you are basking in the glow of having won your first massively multiplayer thumb-wrestling game, let's do a quick recap on the positive emotions. So curiosity.
paragraphs.en: 當你沈浸在你第一次 贏得超級多人拇指摔角 比賽勝利的光榮中時 我們來說說這當中的正面情緒 「好奇心」：

paragraphs.zh-tw: I said "massively multiplayer thumb-wrestling." You were like, "What the hell is she talking about?" So I provoked a little curiosity. Creativity: it took creativity to solve the problem of getting all the thumbs into the node.
paragraphs.en: 當我說「超級多人拇指摔角」的時候 你大概會想：「她到底在說什麼？」 我引發了一些好奇心 「創造力」：把所有的拇指連結到一個節點 需要發揮創造力

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm reaching around and I'm reaching up. So you used creativity. That was great.
paragraphs.en: 要和周遭以及上面的人連結 所以你們發揮了創造力這樣很好

paragraphs.zh-tw: How about surprise? The actual feeling of trying to wrestle two thumbs at onceis pretty surprising. You heard that sound go up in the room.
paragraphs.en: 那「驚喜」呢？ 同時用兩個拇指摔角是很讓人驚喜的事 你聽到了這個房間裡的聲音變大了

paragraphs.zh-tw: We had excitement. As you started to wrestle, maybe you're starting to winor this person's, like, really into it, so you kind of get the excitement going. We have relief. You got to stand up.
paragraphs.en: 還有「興奮」：當你開始摔角的時候 你也許覺得能夠贏過那個人 所以你開始感到興奮 我們得到了「解脫」：你得站起來

paragraphs.zh-tw: You've been sitting for awhile, so the physical relief, getting to shake it out. We had joy. You were laughing, smiling.Look at your faces. This room is full of joy.
paragraphs.en: 你們已經坐著好一陣子了 身體的舒緩把疲勞一掃而空 我們得到了「喜悅」。你們在大笑、微笑看看這些面孔。這個房間裡充滿了喜悅

paragraphs.zh-tw: We had some contentment. I didn't see anybody sending text messagesor checking their email while we were playing, so you were totally content to be playing.
paragraphs.en: 我們感到很滿足 當我們在玩的時候，我沒看到有人在傳訊息或是在看電子郵件 表示你們完全滿足於玩這個遊戲

paragraphs.zh-tw: The most important three emotions, awe and wonder, we had everybodyconnected physically for a minute. When was the last time you were at TED and you got to connect physicallywith every single person in the room? And it's truly awesome and wondrous.
paragraphs.en: 最重要的三個情緒、敬畏、以及驚訝 我們把所有人在生理上連結起來了一分鐘 你們上次在TED演說當中 和在這房間裡的每一個人產生連結是什麼時候？ 這真是令人驚訝又奇妙

paragraphs.zh-tw: And speaking of physical connection, you guys know I love the hormone oxytocin, you release oxytocin, you feel bondedto everyone in the room. You guys know that the best wayto release oxytocin quickly is to hold someone else's handfor at least six seconds.
paragraphs.en: 說到生理上的連結 我很喜歡催產素這個荷爾蒙 當你分泌催產素時你會感到跟這個房間裡的所有人產生了連結 快速分泌催產素的最好方法 就是握住另一個人的手至少六秒

paragraphs.zh-tw: You guys were all holding handsfor way more than six seconds, so we are all now biochemically primed to love each other. That is great. And the last emotion of pride.
paragraphs.en: 你們都握了遠遠超過六秒 所以我們現在正因為生化反應的刺激而愛對方 這很棒 最後一種情緒是「驕傲」

paragraphs.zh-tw: How many people are like me. Just admit it. You lost both your thumbs.
paragraphs.en: 有多少人跟我一樣承認吧 你兩個拇指都輸了

paragraphs.zh-tw: It just didn't work out for you. That's okay, because you learned a new skill today.
paragraphs.en: 那這個情緒就不適用在你身上 但沒關係因為你今天學了一項新技能

paragraphs.zh-tw: You learned, from scratch,a game you never knew before. Now you know how to play it.You can teach other people.
paragraphs.en: 你學到，從基礎開始一個你從來不知道的遊戲 現在你知道如何玩這個遊戲你可以教別人玩

paragraphs.zh-tw: So congratulations. How many of you won just won thumb? All right. I have very good news for you.
paragraphs.en: 恭喜你 有多少人只有贏一個拇指？ 好我有個好消息告訴你們

paragraphs.zh-tw: According to the official rules of massively multiplayer thumb-wrestling, this makes you a grandmaster of the game. Because there aren't that manypeople who know how to play, we have to kind of accelerate the program more than a game like chess.
paragraphs.en: 根據多人拇指摔角的正式規則 根據超級多人拇指摔角的正式規則 這表示你是這個遊戲的大師 因為並沒有很多人知道怎麼玩 我們必須讓更多人認識這個遊戲 讓它變得比西洋棋還要熱門

paragraphs.zh-tw: So congratulations, grandmasters. Win one thumb once, you willbecome a grandmaster.
paragraphs.en: 恭喜，大師們 贏一個拇指就會讓你成為一位大師

paragraphs.zh-tw: Did anybody win both their thumbs? Yes. Awesome. Okay. Get ready to update your Twitter or Facebook status.
paragraphs.en: 有人兩個拇指都贏的嗎？ 有。大棒了。好 準備在Twitter或是Facebook上面更新狀態吧

paragraphs.zh-tw: You guys, according to the rules, are legendary grandmasters, so congratulations. I will just leave you with this tip,if you want to play again.
paragraphs.en: 根據規則 你們是傳奇大師，恭喜 如果你們還想再玩的話讓我告訴你們一個祕訣

paragraphs.zh-tw: The best way to become a legendary grandmaster, you've got your two nodes going on. Pick off the one that looks easiest.
paragraphs.en: 成為一位傳奇大師最好的方法 要同時注意你的兩個節點 選看起來比較容易的那個下手

paragraphs.zh-tw: They're not paying attention. They look kind of weak. Focus on that one and do something crazy with this arm.
paragraphs.en: 別人並不專心他們看起來很弱 專注在那一邊 並用這邊的手臂做些瘋狂事

paragraphs.zh-tw: As soon as you win, suddenly stop. Everybody is thrown off. You go in for the kill.
paragraphs.en: 當你贏了之後馬上停止 每個人都會被分心你就進去大殺四方

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's how you become a legendary grandmasterof massively multiplayer thumb-wrestling. Thank you for letting meteach you my favorite game.
paragraphs.en: 如此就能成為多人拇指摔角的傳奇大師 謝謝你們讓我教你們我最喜歡的遊戲

paragraphs.zh-tw: Wooo! Thank you.
paragraphs.en: 嗚呼！ 謝謝！

title: Jane Mcgonigal Massively Multi Player Thumb Wrestling
